messages.content: This is information about the W5500 chip.
Can you tell me about the W5500 chip?

The W5500 chip is a Hardwired Internet controller designed as a full hardwired TCP/IP stack with WIZnet technology. It provides Internet connectivity to embedded systems using SPI (Serial Peripheral Interface).
This is information about the W5500 chip features.
What are the features of the W5500 chip?

The W5500 chip supports Hardwired TCP/IP Protocols like TCP, UDP, ICMP, IPv4, ARP, IGMP, PPPoE, and supports 8 independent sockets simultaneously. It also supports Power down mode and Wake on LAN over UDP.
This is information about the W5500 chip documents.
Where can I find the documents for the W5500 chip?

Documents for the W5500 chip can be found online. The Korean Data Sheet is available at https://docs.wiznet.io/img/products/w5500/W5500_ds_v110e.pdf, and the English Data Sheet at https://docs.wiznet.io/img/products/w5500/W5500_ds_v110k.pdf.
This is information about the W5500 driver.
What can you tell me about the W5500 driver?

WIZnet's ioLibrary is a comprehensive Internet Offload Library specifically designed for WIZnet chips, including the W5500. It includes a suite of drivers and application protocols to facilitate application designs.
This is information about the W5500 reference schematic.
What are the reference schematics for the W5500?

WIZnet's W5500 product offers diverse connectivity options for various applications. It is presented with different schematic types for enhanced flexibility in design, including the 'External Transformer Type' schematic.
This is information about migrating from W5200 to W5500.
How can I migrate from W5200 to W5500?
WIZnet offers comprehensive migration materials for users transitioning from the W5200 to the W5500 chip. A special driver named w5500_cortexm3_firmware_for_legacy.zip is available for this purpose.
This is information about the W5500 TCP function.
What is the TCP function of the W5500 chip?
The W5500 chip from WIZnet offers a robust TCP function, enabling effective internet connectivity. It requires checking the PHY LINK before any network connection using sockets.
This is information about the W5500 UDP function.
Can you explain the UDP function of the W5500 chip?
The W5500 UDP Function is a feature of WIZnet's W5500 Ethernet controller. It provides internet connectivity by setting various registers and memory operations.
This is information about the W5500 IPRAW mode.
What is the IPRAW mode in W5500?
The IPRAW mode of the WIZnet W5500 chip can handle the IP layer's upper protocol in the TCP/IP stack, making it versatile for various applications.
This is information about the W5500 PPPoE.
What does PPPoE mean in the context of the W5500?

In the context of the W5500, PPP (Point-to-Point Protocol) and PPPoE (Point-to-Point Protocol over Ethernet) are used in MACRAW mode for establishing a direct connection to a Network Access Server (NAS).
This is information about the W5500 SPI performance.
How does the W5500 perform in terms of SPI?
The W5500 showcases impressive SPI performance, especially when evaluated with different MCU configurations and SPI clock speeds.
This is information about the W5500-EVB.
What is the W5500-EVB?
The W5500-EVB is an evaluation board for the W5500 chip, designed as a development platform for microcontroller applications with network connectivity.
This is a guide on getting started with the W5500-EVB.
How do I get started with the W5500-EVB?
To start with the W5500-EVB, connect it to a PC using a USB cable, attach a LAN cable, and follow the steps for initial operation and testing.
This is a guide on making new projects with the W5500-EVB.
How can I create new projects with the W5500-EVB?
To create new projects with the W5500-EVB, use the LPCXpresso IDE for development and follow the steps for project creation and configuration.
This is information on how to install and activate the LPCXpresso IDE.
How do I install and activate the LPCXpresso IDE?
You can install and activate the LPCXpresso IDE by following the instructions provided at https://docs.wiznet.io/Product/iEthernet/W5500/W5500-EVB/how-to-install-and-activate-lpcxpresso.
This is information about the W5500-EVB-Pico.
What is the W5500-EVB-Pico?
The W5500-EVB-Pico is an evaluation board based on the Raspberry Pi RP2040 and W5500, offering additional Ethernet functionality and compatibility with various platforms.
This is information about the W5500 firmware example.
Where can I find firmware examples for the W5500?
Firmware examples for the W5500 can be found at https://docs.wiznet.io/Product/iEthernet/W5500/w5500-evb-pico#firmware-example.
